acceptanceCriteria.ac: Create examples/animations/bouncing_ball.rs implementing physics simulation with gravity, velocity, and bounce. Ball bounces within terminal bounds. Demonstrates AnimationLoop with physics calculations. Shows real-time FPS counter. Graceful Ctrl+C exit. Compiles and runs: cargo run --example bouncing_ball

Create examples/animations/loading_spinner.rs implementing rotating loading indicator using braille dots. Multiple spinner styles (dot, arc, circle). Demonstrates FrameTimer for consistent rotation speed. Shows "Loading..." text with animated spinner. Graceful Ctrl+C exit. Compiles and runs: cargo run --example loading_spinner

Create examples/animations/waveform.rs implementing animated sine wave or audio-like waveform. Demonstrates line drawing primitives from Epic 4. Scrolling waveform animation. Uses color scheme from Epic 5 for visual appeal. Graceful Ctrl+C exit. Compiles and runs: cargo run --example waveform

Create examples/animations/fireworks.rs implementing basic particle system with firework explosions. Demonstrates multiple animated objects (particles). Shows color blending/fading effects. Random burst patterns. Graceful Ctrl+C exit. Compiles and runs: cargo run --example fireworks

Create examples/animations/clock.rs implementing real-time analog clock face with moving hands. Hour, minute, second hands. Uses circle and line drawing from Epic 4. Updates at 1 FPS or uses system time. Graceful Ctrl+C exit. Compiles and runs: cargo run --example clock

Create docs/animation_guide.md covering: Quick Start (5 lines to animate), Double Buffering with FrameBuffer, Frame Timing with FrameTimer, AnimationLoop for simple animations, Pre-rendering for complex scenes, Differential rendering for CPU optimization. Includes code snippets for each concept. Links to example files for deeper exploration.

docs.doc: Authoritative acceptance criteria AC6.6.1-6.6.9. Defines all 5 animation examples (bouncing_ball, loading_spinner, waveform, fireworks, clock), comprehensive tutorial (animation_guide.md), README update, and rustdoc verification requirements.

Defines examples/ directory structure, Cargo.toml example entries, and module organization patterns. Animation module at src/animation/ with frame_buffer.rs, timing.rs, loop.rs, prerender.rs, differential.rs.

Defines animation functional requirements: FR38 (frame-by-frame animations), FR39 (frame timing control), FR40 (animation loops), FR41 (frame buffer management), FR42 (pre-rendered frames), FR43 (flicker-free rendering), FR48 (integration examples).

Contains bouncing ball physics pattern to reuse (Ball struct, update physics, draw methods). DifferentialRenderer API example. Terminal setup/cleanup patterns with guard pattern. 225-line differential_demo.rs as template.
Examples organization and patterns. Provides template for documenting new animation examples.
Current README structure. Animation section needs to be added per AC8. Quick start example pattern available for reference.

dependency.name: crossterm
dependency.purpose: Cross-platform terminal I/O, keyboard events (Ctrl+C), cursor control

dependencies.notes: No new dependencies required for Story 6.6. All animation APIs are implemented in pure Rust using existing dependencies. std::time used for clock example (system time).

constraints.constraint: Examples must use public API from src/lib.rs re-exports, not internal module paths
All examples in examples/animations/ subdirectory require [[example]] entries in Cargo.toml with path attribute
Examples must include #![allow(clippy::...)] for cast warnings that are acceptable in demos
Examples must compile with zero clippy warnings: cargo clippy --examples -- -D warnings
Examples are also checked by Clippy in CI. All code in examples/ must pass clippy checks with no warnings.
Ctrl+C handling must use crossterm event polling pattern from existing examples
Terminal cleanup must restore cursor visibility and clear screen on exit
Physics calculations use f64 for precision, cast to usize for grid coordinates
Ball struct pattern: x, y as f64, vx, vy as f64, radius as usize
Every public item needs rustdoc with # Examples section and working code blocks
Rustdoc examples must compile via cargo test --doc

tests.standards: Testing follows Rust conventions: unit tests in #[cfg(test)] mod tests at bottom of each module file, integration tests in tests/ directory, doc tests in /// code blocks that compile via cargo test --doc. Examples are tested via cargo build --examples and cargo clippy --examples -- -D warnings. Benchmarks use criterion in benches/ directory with [[bench]] entries in Cargo.toml.
